title: Apprentice star leaves hilarious TripAdvisor review at show's 'loser cafe'
text:

The Apprentice's Dean Ahmad has left a hilarious review of the 'loser cafe' where the losing team from the challenge sit and await their fate before going back into the boardroom.

While the winning team are enjoying their prize, the candidates sitting in the Bridge Cafe discuss where they went wrong, knowing one of them is going to be 'fired' from the show.

Dean Ahmad, a 20-year-old sports management agency owner from Essex, decided to leave a Tripadvisor review on the cafe's website, after he has found himself in the losing team for the first two episodes of the BBC show.

(Image: PA)

He gave the cafe four stars, and called it a "great cafe for a break from the boardroom" and praised it's reasonable pricing.

"At the end of the day, it might look like a dive but this cafe is the perfect hideout for when a man is a little emosh", he wrote.

"Found myself here a bit too much lately, through some of the darkest days when in a bit of a barney rubble.

"But for 90p a cup and a quarter pounder that caught my eye a few times, this place definitely deserved a shout out.

"Probably the cheapest brew in all of town".

(Image: twitter)

The boy's team fell short in last week's show when their rather rudely-shaped ice lollies failed to impress.

Project manager Kenna Ngoma got the boot, after bringing Rysn-Mark Parsons and Dean back into the boardroom with him.

Kenna has since told the MailOnline he thought Dean should have been fired, and was surprised he managed to stay in the process.

"I am gutted to be out. I didn't expect it to happen", he said.

"When it happened I was devastated. I thought it was going to be Dean and I calmed down when Lord Sugar said he had lost us profit. But then he flipped back to me and I knew.

"When they said they sold nothing, I knew I was a dead man walking."

(Image: twitter)

Dean's review continues: "Proper place, pukka pies looked as if they'd seen better days but I had some fond memories here despite everything.

"Last few visits weren't my own choice but I'd definitely be back at my own leisure.

"Top notch tea and staff always welcomed me and my guess no matter the mood we were in."

He concluded: "Less blue sky thinking, more tea drinking if you know what I mean."

(Image: PA)

Meanwhile, Kenna is now reportedly considering going on Love Island in his bid to become a reality TV star.

Speaking to Mirror TV, he said that the experience certainly hadn't put him off appearing in more reality TV shows and is keen to stay on telly.

He said: "Definitely, because it's a way to keep my business in the public eye to do more TV work."

Asked whether he'd be interested in doing Love Island, he replied: "Yeah that's on my to do list! Not to find love, obviously."

Speaking about his future plans, Kenna said: "For me, it's to launch my vegan apple and cheese ice cream product my Christmas time. But yeah, definitely like I said, to stay in the public eye and to do more TV work."

*The Apprentice returns next Wednesday at 9pm on BBC One
description: The Apprentice star Dean praised the cafe's pricing and quarter pounder burgers
